title: Napkin, ca. 1910
medium:
Material: Linen.  Quality no. 45.
Technique: 4 & 1 satin damask.
signed: Woven label sewn to back on one corner: "Lohnis" in red.
dimensions: Warp x Weft: 66.7 x 69.9 cm (26 1/4 x 27 1/2 in.)
creditline: Museum purchase from Alice Baldwin Beer Memorial Fund
description:
Field: Units of 4 pine cones with one for a 14 1/2 in. square. 
Borders: Units of 3 pine cones with one in each corner.
"DV" in each corner.
